Sofyan Basir Bebas, KPK Akan Ajukan Kasasi
05 Nov 2019, 07:58 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


Sofyan Basir Bebas, KPK Akan Ajukan Kasasi

KBRN, Jakarta : Wakil Ketua Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) Saut Situmorang mengungkapkan KPK akan segera mengajukan kasasi atas vonis bebas Majelis Hakim Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) Jakarta terhadap Sofyan Basir.Â "Ya kemarin sudah, hanya berapa jam setelah putusan itu kita akan berkumpul semua kita putuskan kita akan melakukan kasasi. Tinggal nunggu putusannya saja, kita pelajari," jelasnya kepada RRI, Selasa (5/11/2019).Menurutnya dalam dunia hukum semua harus melakukan check and balance. Hukum harus ditegakkan seadil-adilnya sesuai dengan aturan yang berlaku."Yang paling penting adalah bagaimana kita bisa menegakkan hukum dengan seperti apa yang diamanahkan kriminalisasi sistem kita," katanya.Ia mengatakan dirinya tidak ingin membeberkan terlebih dahulu apa saja yang akan menjadi bahan ketika di peradilan nanti."Perdebatannya kalau kita bicara formil materilnya kan inspeknya tidak di media, karena nanti akan jadi polemik. Jadi segala sesuatu yang dianggap pro dan kontra disini tempatnya itu di meja peradilan itu sendiri," tutupnya.Sebelumnya, KPK mempertimbangkan mengajukan kasasi pasca putusan bebas Sofyan oleh Majelis Hakim pada Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) Jakarta, Senin."Dalam konteks kali ini, selain mempelajari lebih lanjut kemudian Jaksa Penuntut Umum (JPU) memberikan rekomendasi kepada pimpinan, alternatif lamgkah-langkah upaya hukum yang bisa dilakukan selain dari proses itu, tentu ada kasasi," ucap Juru Bicara KPK Febri Diansyah di gedung KPK, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Diketahui, Sofyan divonis bebas dari semua dakwaan jaksa penuntut umum KPK dalam perkara dugaan pembantuan kesepakatan proyek Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Uap Mulut Tambang Riau-1 (PLTU MT Riau-1).

Sofyan Basir is free, the KPK will file an appeal
05 Nov 2019, 07:58 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


Sofyan Basir is free, the KPK will file an appeal

KBRN, Jakarta: Deputy Chairman of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) Saut Situmorang revealed that the KPK would immediately file an appeal against the Jakarta Corruption Court (Tipikor) Corruption Court Judge's verdict against Sofyan Basir. "Yes, yesterday, just a few hours after the verdict, we will gather. We decided that we will conduct an appeal. Just wait for the verdict, we will study," he explained to RRI, Tuesday (11/05/2019). According to him in the legal world, all must be check and balance. The law must be upheld as fairly as possible in accordance with applicable regulations. "The most important thing is how we can enforce the law with what is mandated by the criminalization of our system," he said. He said he did not want to disclose in advance what would be material when in "The debate is if we talk about the material form, the inspections will not be in the media, because later it will become polemic. So everything that is considered pros and cons here is the place on the judicial table itself," he concluded. Sofyan was released by the Panel of Judges at the Jakarta Corruption Court (Tipikor) on Monday. "In this context, in addition to further learning, the Public Prosecutor (JPU) gave recommendations to the leadership, alternative legal remedies that could be taken apart from the process, of course there is appeal, "said KPK Spokesman Febri Diansyah at the KPK building, J akarta, Monday (4/11/2019). It is known, Sofyan was acquitted of all charges of the KPK's public prosecutor in the alleged case of assisting an agreement on the Riau Mine-1 Steam Mouth Power Plant project (PLTU MT Riau-1).
